Farrell Reynolds, president of Turner Broadcasting Sales, is joining Whittle Communications as chairman and chief executive of its newly restructured Whittle Educational Network.
At the unit of the Turner

Broadcasting System, Mr. Reynolds had overall responsibiity for advertising sales for all company networks including the superstation TBS, Turner Network Television, Cable News Network and Headline News.
At Whittle, based in Knoxville, Tenn., he will oversee a unit that has several advertising-based properties, including two television channels, a magazine and a sampling operation.

Christopher Whittle, chairman of Whittle Communications, said on Friday that the education network was expected to become one of the company's largest business units, with revenues of $125 million by 1991.
